# University Museum Visits

Southern Utah Museum of Art invites SUU faculty to reserve a time for students to engage with our diverse [ exhibitions ](https://www.suu.edu/suma/exhibits/upcoming.html) and growing [ collections.](https://suu.edu/suma/collections.html)

## **How can the museum be a resource for your curriculum?**

**1\. Guided Tours** Schedule a guided tour for your class, department, or guest lecturers/professors coming to campus. These visits can be tailored to your syllabus, requiring a two-week notice. 

[Sign up for a Tour!](https://sumatours.simplybook.me/v2/#book)

**2\. Extended Museum Visits** Request an extended visit to view selections from our growing collections, which allows you to develop meaningful connections between your curriculum and our collections. These visits can be arranged with a 30-day notice. If you are interested in touring requested works of art in the permanent collection, please email us at [experiencesuma@suu.edu](mailto:experiencesuma@suu.edu)

**3\. Independent Visits** This is an excellent option for educators looking for an interdisciplinary way to challenge conceptual understanding, build observational skills, or practice language outside of the classroom. We would love to partner with you to create a meaningful experience for your students at SUMA. accessibility_text:
# Accessibility at SUMA

# Accessibility at SUMA

Southern Utah Museum of Art is committed to making our museum accessible to all of our visitors. Our goal is to prioritize accessibility in all we do, which includes, but is not limited to, visitor exhibition experience and all community programming. We value your feedback as we are always looking at ways to improve accessibility at SUMA.

If you have a specific accommodation request, or have an issue with our website, please contact our Coordinator of Visitor Experience, Rebecca Hughes (she/her) at [rebeccahughes2@suu.edu](mailto:rebeccahughes2@suu.edu) or by calling [(435) 586-5432](tel:\(435\)%20586-5432).
collections_text:
# Welcome to SUMA

Southern Utah Museum of Art, on the campus of Southern Utah University in Cedar City, features the artwork of regional artists known for their landscapes such as Maynard Dixon, Edith Hamlin, and Jimmie F. Jones, as well as emerging and distinguished artists from around the country and the world. Within SUMA’s holdings is an especially robust collection of prints that includes well-known artists such as Marc Chagall, James McNeill Whistler, Kawase Hasui, Thomas Hart Benton, and Käthe Kollwitz, among others. Named the best-designed museum in Utah by _Architectural Digest_ , SUMA’s building, designed by Brooks + Scarpa and inspired by the region’s famed slot canyons, is an artwork in and of itself.

**SUMA is free and open to the public.**
